intro: Lithocarpus benzoin, commonly known as the benzoin chinquapin, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches. It is a broadleaf evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Philippines and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and produces a hard, woody fruit that contains a single seed. Its bark is rich in aromatic compounds, making it valuable in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils. The species plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, supporting a variety of wildlife.
